Julius Lehmann to Abraham Lincoln, 4 May 18581 I have by my Atty[Attorney] MrHolmescommenced an action of Slander vs DrH Schroederofthis place& wish to engage your legal services at the trial & generally in the case with Mr.Dr H.2 Will you write me whether you will
               accept of a retaner[retainer]3 Mark me down on your side–
paragraphs: Julius Lehmann to Abraham Lincoln, 4 May 18581
I have by my Atty[Attorney] MrHolmescommenced an action of Slander vs DrH Schroederofthis place& wish to engage your legal services at the trial & generally in the case with Mr.Dr H.2

Will you write me whether you will
               accept of a retaner[retainer]3
Mark me down on your side–
citations: Lehman v. Schroeder, Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),https://lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=136776.

footnotes.text: 1Julius Lehmann wrote and signed this letter.

2Abraham Lincoln agreed to serve as one of Lehmann’s lawyers and the case commenced
                  inMcLean County Circuit Courtin January 1859. Lehmann demanded $5,000 in damages from Dr. Herman Schroeder for
                  slander. He won the case on January 8, but only kept $50 of the awarded $5,000.Lehman v. Schroeder, Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),https://lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=136776.

3A return letter from Lincoln to Lehmann has not been found, but Lincoln endorsed the
                  back of this letter.
